page.title: 02FARMING
page.content: Arable farming is the main occupation of the area.The main crops are cereals(barley,wheat and oats),potatoes and sugar beet.The sugar beet is taken to the York factory for processing.Oil seed rape and peas are also grown.The grass is made into hay and silage,the later both in clamp and tower as well as large round bales.Water from the Rivers Swale and Ure,Derrings Beck and also from bore holes are used to irrigate the land in dry weather. There is one dairy farm and two farms have suckler herds.Two of the farms keep their own bull.There are three flocks of breeding sheep with lambing in January and February and some other farms keep store sheep for fattening over winter/Intensive pig and poultryfarming features in the
